name: INSTITUTE OF CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS OF CYPRUS (ΣΥΝΔΕΣΜΟΣ ΕΓΚΕΚΡΙΜΕΝΩΝ ΛΟΓΙΣΤΩΝ ΚΥΠΡΟΥ)
legal: PRIVATE COMPANY WITH LIABILITY LIMITED BY GUARANTEE
memberOrga: ICPAC comprises of natural persons as members and licenses both natural and persons regarding the public practice of the accountancy profession in the Republic of Cyprus. To that effect, reference is made to the Registry of Licensed Persons, publicly accessible, under the heading entitled 'Registries' at the ICPAC website with electronic address https://www.icpac.org.cy/selk/en/default.aspx .
goal: ICPAC is the relevant authority for the accountancy profession in the Republic of Cyprus. Established in 1961, ICPAC currently has more than 4.800 professional accountants as members and another 4.000 students and graduates. ICPAC's main aims are to: (a) provide an organisational framework to all professional accountants of Cyprus, (b) provide professional training, guidance and education to its members, (c) regulate the profession, by means of issuing the practising licences and monitoring the work performed by the practising members and their firms, (d) ensure adherence to the Code of Ethics, and (e) promote the interests of the members and the accountancy profession. ICPAC's mission statement relates to: (a) empower its members by providing appropriate knowledge, training, guidance and support, (b) promote the highest professional & ethical ideals, (c) be the essential partner of the State for the matters relating to the economy, and (d) advance the public interest. ICPAC's vision statement is to be 'a model professional body, recognised by the State and society as the primary stakeholder for the accountancy profession and the economy in general, instilling confidence, credibility and value'. ICPAC's principal objectives include the provision of an organisational framework for all professional accountants, the support and the promotion of the activities and interests of the accountancy profession, as well as the continuous professional development and updating of its Μembers. ICPAC is the only recognised by the Council of Ministers body of accountants in the Republic of Cyprus (since 2002) and the competent authority for licensing of statutory auditors and audit firms (as per Delegation Agreement between ICPAC and Cyprus Public Audit Oversight Board since 2017 pursuant to the provisions of the Auditors' Law of 2017). ICPAC is also a competent authority for licensing and monitoring its members under the Law Regulating Companies Providing Administrative Services and Related Matters, the Insolvency Practitioners Laws of 2015 and of the Law for the Prevention and Suppression of Money Laundering Activities, as well as the Implementation of Provisions of Resolutions or Decisions of the United Nations Security Council (Sanctions) and the Decisions and Regulations of the Council of the European Union (Restrictive Measures) Law of 2016 [Law 58 (I)/2016]. ICPAC is a key stakeholder in the economy of the country, playing a vital role to establish and maintain the Republic of Cyprus as an international business centre of repute. It provides assistance to the Government of the Republic of Cyprus and its departments, as well as cooperates harmoniously with other bodies in the private sector. Furthermore, ICPAC cooperates via a network of international accountancy and other professional bodies. ICPAC has concluded co-operation agreements and protocols with international and regional bodies: (a) ACCA - Association of Chartered Certified Accountants, UK, (b) ICAEW - Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales, UK, (c) ICSA_ the Governance Institute, UK, (d) IoD - Institute of Directors, UK, (e) ICA - International Compliance Association, UK, (f) IBE - Institute of Business Ethics, UK, (g) ACFE - Association of Certified Fraud Examiners, Republic of Cyprus & Hellenic Republic, (h) FAP - Fraud Advisory Panel, UK,(i) MIA - Malta Institute of Accountants, (j) SRRS - Serbian Association of Accountants & Auditors, and (k) CAFR - Chamber of Financial Auditors of Romania. ICPAC has also concluded agreements with the following: (a) CyPAOB - The Cyprus Public Audit Oversight Board, (b) CySEC - The Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission, (c) The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Cyprus (Economic Diplomacy), (d) CUT - The Cyprus University of Technology, and (e) CIF - Cyprus Integrity Forum.
interests: Banking and financial services, Budget, Business and Industry, Competition, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Fraud prevention, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: ICPAC is interested in actively participating in EU initiatives and discussions pertaining to (a) the regulation of the audit profession, including matters of implementation of specific legislative instruments such as Directive 2006/43/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2006 on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts and Regulation (EU) No 537/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 on specific requirements regarding statutory audit of public-interest entities, (b) the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purposes of money laundering or terrorist financing, including matters of implementation of specific legislative instruments such as Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 May 2018 amending Directive (EU) 2015/849 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purposes of money laundering or terrorist financing, (c) the entrenchment of personal data protection via legislative initiatives such as The General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR), (d) matters related to the EU taxation policy and actions such as the implementation of Council Directive (EU) 2018/822 of 25 May 2018 amending Directive 2011/16/EU as regards mandatory automatic exchange of information in the field of taxation in relation to reportable cross-border arrangements, (e) matters related to the EU Foreign Investment Policy including Regulation (EU) 2019/452 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 19 March 2019 establishing a framework for the screening of foreign direct investments into the Union, (f) contemporary matters of transformative effect including Brexit and the interaction thereof with legislative measures such as Directive 2005/36/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 7 September 2005 on the recognition of professional qualifications, Directive 2006/43/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 May 2006 on statutory audits of annual accounts and consolidated accounts and related EU Commission Notices to Stakeholders such as regarding the field of Regulated Professions and the Recognition of Professional Qualifications and the Field of Statutory Audit, (g) competition law matters, as well as (h) matters relating to general accountancy practices, including international accounting standards and the internaction thereof with legislative instruments such as Directive 2013/34/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 June 2013 on the annual financial statements, consolidated financial statements and related reports of certain types of undertakings. In addition, ICPAC intends to contribute in the discourse related to Ethics, Compliance, Transparency and Anti - Corruption.
